snippet: The withdrawal of two witnesses is the latest setback to increased concerns that Uhuru Kenyatta will be cleared of charges of crimes against humanity.
abstract: Two witnesses in International Criminal Court case against Kenya's Pres Uhuru Kenyatta withdraw their testimony because of safety concerns; Kenyatta is accused of using his extensive family fortune to finance death squads in the midst of violence that broke out after Kenya's presidential election in 2007.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and MARLISE SIMONS

lead_paragraph: The withdrawal of two witnesses is the latest setback to increased concerns that Uhuru Kenyatta will be cleared of charges of crimes against humanity.

headline.main: Setbacks Rise in Prosecuting the President of Kenya
headline.print_headline: Setbacks Rise In Prosecuting The President Of Kenya

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
